0.76.text: Since it's very much autumn now,

2.84.text: I thought it would only be right to do another baking video.

6.56.text: I feel like baking is quite an autumnal thing

9.30.text: It's quite cosy, you get to use a lot of cinnamon.

11.64.text: So today, I have decided to do some apple crumble cupcakes.

18.44.text: For the cupcake mixture, you will need:

28.10.text: 125 grams of butter, unsalted at room temperature

38.62.text: and for the apple mixture, which we will be adding to the cupcake mixture,

45.96.text: Once you have successfully measured out all your ingredients,

48.48.text: the first thing that you are gonna need to do is make your apple mixture.

52.14.text: For this, you need to take your apples

54.06.text: and you need to peel them,

56.56.text: and chop them into little squares.

59.74.text: Once you have your apple squares,

61.90.text: you are going to want to put them into a large saucepan

65.14.text: and cover them in water and leave them to simmer.

68.26.text: You're going to want to leave them to simmer in the saucepan for about 5 to 7 minutes

72.24.text: until the apples are much, much softer.

74.88.text: You can also add a tablespoon of golden caster sugar, just to give it a little bit more sweetness.

79.88.text: Personally, I have used two cooking apples and one golden delicious

84.18.text: just to give it a little bit of sweetness,

85.94.text: but it really doesn't matter what apples you use.

88.24.text: You can even go and pick your own.

97.54.text: First thing you want to do is to cream together your butter and your caster sugar.

103.30.text: So, I'm gonna pop that in the kitchen aid

105.86.text: which does all the hard work for me.

107.68.text: And then I'm gonna pop the sugar in,

110.36.text: and I'm gonna beat that until it is light and fluffy.

114.32.text: Just make sure it is all off the sides and mixed in properly.

119.24.text: Next, you want to add your eggs,

143.26.text: Next thing you want to do is to add all your dry ingredients,

146.22.text: so starting with your plain flour

161.54.text: And give it a big old mix up.

166.14.text: Make sure all the ingredients are in the mixture.

177.64.text: And this is where you're going to want to incorporate your apple mixture

184.00.text: But we don't wanna mix it in the kitchen aid

186.80.text: because the apple will go all mushy

188.92.text: and we want it to kind of stay a little bit more whole.

193.20.text: You don't have to add all of your apple

207.06.text: Mix that in and see what it's like.

212.48.text: I feel like we can add a teeny bit more

216.94.text: you can use it for decoration

219.18.text: or turn it into an apple puree.

223.62.text: before you spoon your mixture into the cupcake cases, be sure to preheat your oven to 170 degree Celsius.

230.90.text: I feel like this is perfect,

233.14.text: so now all you have to do is grab your cupcake tin and your preferred cupcake cases.

239.00.text: I decided to use these cute golden cupcake cases so I'm going to carry on popping them in the tray

246.76.text: okay. Now for the messy bit

249.14.text: of trying to spoon the mixture evenly into each cupcake case.

258.72.text: Now you're going to want to put your cupcakes in the oven

261.26.text: for 15 to 20 minutes, just making sure that a skewer comes out completely clean

266.82.text: and they are slightly golden on the top

269.42.text: Whilst your cupcakes are in the oven,

271.10.text: you're gonna want to make some crumble topping which is mostly for decoration

275.40.text: but also you can't have apple crumble cupcakes without some crumble.

283.02.text: 100 grams of slightly salted chilled butter

291.86.text: and a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon.

294.80.text: So, we're going to put the chilled butter into a big old bowl,

304.26.text: Big old spoon in! *giggles* There we go!

307.74.text: And I'm also going to add,

314.96.text: and a little bit of the vanilla extract,

318.16.text: and you're gonna have to get a bit messy.

320.84.text: 'Cause you're gonna have to use your hands to combine everything together.

324.82.text: To form little bits of, kinda of bread crumbs, I guess.

328.12.text: That's the kind of texture you're going for.

330.48.text: It's been a while since I've used my hands in baking cause' I have a kitchen aid. This is SO disgusting...

337.04.text: So all the ingredients should come together

345.10.text: Pour in your golden caster sugar and then just mix it in with a spoon,

349.40.text: so you don't need to use your hands for this bit.

354.68.text: In order for your crumble to go a little bit golden and to be cooked slightly,

360.18.text: I am going to pop it out on a tray, just lined with baking paper.

365.42.text: And I'm going to pop it in the oven for around

369.72.text: but you just have to keep checking it

371.30.text: depending on how much you cooked.

372.92.text: You don't want it to burn, but you want it to be nice and golden.

378.32.text: without putting it on top the the pie.

381.88.text: To be honest, my favourite part of an apple crumble, is always the crumble.

386.56.text: For the brown sugar buttercream icing, you will need:

399.26.text: 250 grams of unsalted butter at room temperature,

406.04.text: Lastly, you will need a little bit of whole milk.

411.06.text: But it completely depends on how you want your texture of your buttercream.

415.10.text: The more you add, the more loose it is.

417.30.text: The less you add, the more thick it is.

419.94.text: So, it's completely up to you.

421.94.text: The trick with butter icing, which I say every time is that you have to beat

426.08.text: the butter for a really long time.

429.62.text: And in this case, we have to beat it

434.66.text: So I'm going to add the butter first

438.84.text: I'm also going to add the brown sugar at this point,

446.22.text: and you wanna beat this for

447.82.text: I would say for around 5 to 7 minutes,

451.36.text: until it all looks very light and fluffy.

458.60.text: I'm just gonna make sure everything is mixing as it should be.

467.68.text: Once your butter is super light, fluffy and creamy,

470.90.text: you want to add the icing sugar.

472.90.text: You're gonna want to do this a little bit at a time,

476.02.text: and start at a really slow speed

477.62.text: or as I always say, you'll end up in a cloud of icing sugar.

484.36.text: Now you are gonna wanna add some milk

486.84.text: until you feel that it is the right consistency.

489.86.text: You don't want it too runny or you'll find that piping on top of

493.08.text: your cupcakes is a little bit difficult.

495.24.text: But, you do want it to be a bit easier than if you just had this.

499.58.text: So, I'm gonna start with one tablespoon, and then see how we go.

510.32.text: I'm going to add a little bit more.

512.34.text: I think it only needs another half a tablespoon.

529.00.text: Always takes longer than I think it's gonna take to do icing.

532.20.text: But, if you want it to taste good,

535.68.text: you gotta put the time in.

537.34.text: Don't leave any on your kitchen aid.

540.74.text: I am happy with that, so let's get that off.

545.58.text: Once your cakes and crumble has completely cooled;

549.94.text: you don't want any of this to be slightest bit warm

552.84.text: because the butter icing doesn't bode well with heat.

556.44.text: Everything will melt, and it will still taste great, but not look as pretty.

560.20.text: Erm, so you got to let them cool down, but once that have, it's time to decorate.

565.42.text: You know I love my trusty piping bag,

567.70.text: so I've gone for a star nozzle, which is a 10 Tarla nozzle,

572.20.text: just in case any of you are wondering.

573.88.text: And I'm using a medium-sized piping bag, because I don't have any large ones at the moment.

578.42.text: But a large one would probably be better.

580.42.text: And I'm gonna spoon my buttercream into my piping bag.

589.94.text: so you can hold it like this in one hand,

591.78.text: and you can move it around the top of the cupcake with the other hand.

595.34.text: So I'm gonna place that down here for now; that's ready to go.

598.12.text: In order for the crumble to sit neatly on top of the cupcake,

601.82.text: I'm gonna do a small smearing of icing on top.

610.94.text: And then I'm going to pop the crumble on top,

615.34.text: And then pipe the icing on top of that.

619.62.text: I feel like if you wanted to, you could leave it like this,

622.84.text: but I quite wanna pipe on top, just because I think it might look quite pretty.

632.52.text: I feel like these are the perfect cupcakes for this time of year,

636.52.text: we're about to start getting out the pumpkin recipes as well,

639.66.text: but apple crumble, you really can't go wrong.

644.76.text: Your twelve apple crumble cupcakes are finally ready to eat.

648.88.text: I think they look quite impressive,

651.72.text: you could probably share these with someone else as they are quite mammoth

654.90.text: But, they look so delicious, I'm really happy with how they turned out.

658.58.text: If you decide that you want to recreate this recipe,

661.10.text: then make sure to tweet me or instagram me,

665.54.text: so that I can see how delicious yours look.

667.68.text: If you want to see more recipes, then leave some suggestions

671.64.text: Give the video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it,

673.74.text: and I will see you again soon!

674.90.text: *Ring* I should probably try it, shouldn't I?

677.56.text: It's not a baking video, unless you try your own cake.

680.18.text: You guys could think: "Maybe they're rubbish, how would we ever know?"

685.90.text: Oh my god, how am I going to do this?

699.22.text: I feel like these are some of the best cupcakes I've ever made.
